snippet: The rebels have been pulled between the limits of a lightly equipped guerrilla force and their urge to fight with the battlefield weight of an army.
abstract: Rebel fighters in northern Syria attempt shift from guerrilla tactics, opening a front on the arid flatlands west of the Aleppo-Damascus highway; hope is that by severing Syria's main highway, ammunition in army outposts at  Idlib and Hama, sources of much of the shelling of civilian neighborhoods, will be depleted, allowing outposts to be defeated piecemeal.
lead_paragraph: The rebels have been pulled between the limits of a lightly equipped guerrilla force and their urge to fight with the battlefield weight of an army.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebels Attempt Shift From Guerrilla Tactics
headline.main: Syrian Rebels Meet Setbacks on a New Front
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Syria, Opening a Front, Meet Obstacles

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
